lead_paragraph: The automaker said 70 percent of its drop in revenue — around $1.4 billion — was related to the strong United States currency.

headline.print_headline: Income Falls for Ford, but Forecast Is Rosier
headline.main: Ford Reports Lower Income, but It Sees Better Days Ahead

snippet: The automaker said 70 percent of its drop in revenue — around $1.4 billion — was related to the strong United States currency.
abstract: Ford reports first-quarter net income of $924 million, or 23 cents per share, down 6.6 percent from year-earlier period; results fall short of analyst expectations, but company reaffirms profit outlook for year.
